subject: Old pro plus
description_text: Hello dear simsonn team, I bought the simsonn pro plus via Amazon months ago. The white stuff on the pedals from the loadcell looked like it driped, but it is solid so i didnt took more thoughts about it. My problem is now i have to recalibrate the pedals every 2 -3 days. It's like the start point is changing. Additionally u have to set a decent dead zone because it's always sending signals. Yes I used the ground cable and yes this happens no matter if the wheelbase is active or not. Best regards Dennis -- Gesendet mit der WEB.DE Mail App

conversations.body_text: Hi Dennis Hamzic,      Could you please provide a video? It will help us assist you in resolving the issue more quickly.

Hello, There is a picture of the loadcell attached. I try to do a video later. It's basically just like microstutters so I have to increase the dead zone and every few days I have to recalibrate it. Best regards Dennis -- Gesendet mit der WEB.DE Mail App Am 04.06.25, 14:09 schrieb "service@simsonn.com"
你好，Dennis Hamzic，  好的，我们期待收到您的视频。
Hello, Today its okay with the problems. But somedays its stronger. I cant attach the video its to big. -- Gesendet mit der WEB.DE Mail App Am 05.06.25, 06:45 schrieb "service@simsonn.com"

Hi，Dennis Hamzic，   Could you please install Todesk? It doesn’t require registration and is safe to use.  Once installed, just provide your ID and temporary password, and I’ll assist you remotely to resolve the issue.
Would prefer not to. But what's with the problem with the white loadcell liquids on the pedals? -- Gesendet mit der WEB.DE Mail App Am 14.06.25, 05:48 schrieb "service@simsonn.com"
Hi Dennis Hamzic,  It is designed to absorb vibrations and enhance the rigidity of the platform spring without interfering with the spring itself, effectively simulating a hydraulic pedal feel.
Hello, But why did it looked liked it leaked? -- Gesendet mit der WEB.DE Mail App Am 16.06.25, 05:09 schrieb "service@simsonn.com"
Hi Dennis Hamzic, I'm not quite sure what you mean—could you please clarify?
I attached a picture. -- Gesendet mit der WEB.DE Mail App Am 17.06.25, 05:18 schrieb "service@simsonn.com"
Hi Dennis Hamzic,  It contains gas inside, and if it leaks, it will no longer function properly. If it’s indeed faulty, I’ll send you a replacement part free of charge.
Hello, Brake looks like a little bit of leak Gas definitely And clutch also a bit -- Gesendet mit der WEB.DE Mail App Am 18.06.25, 11:36 schrieb "service@simsonn.com"
Hello, Will it be a new load cell or new dampers you would send? -- Gesendet mit der WEB.DE Mail App Am 18.06.25, 11:36 schrieb "service@simsonn.com"

Hello Dear Simsonn Support, Here a list with all the problems I encountered: Load cell liquid looked liked it's dripping. The dampers start to to bring bring grease on the rod. The screws that hold the plate of the brake pads look like they don't fit perfectly. The holding brackets of the load cell at the brake pedal looks a bit short (maybe it's just in my mind but if I apply full force on the brake pedals it feels like its bending) Because i bought them via Amazon, should I submit a ticket there or can I send them back to you directly or could you exchange the brakes? Also is it possible to exchange the hydraulic rods? Best regards Dennis Hamzic -- Gesendet mit der WEB.DE Mail App Am 18.06.25, 11:36 schrieb "service@simsonn.com"
Hi Dennis Hamzic,  The brake sensor is a pressure sensor, and slight deformation under heavy braking is normal. We will send you replacement parts free of charge, so please feel assured in using it.

Hello, What information you need for the replacement? Or is it possible to get the upgrade kit (i can also pay for it)? Best regards Dennis -- Gesendet mit der WEB.DE Mail App Am 23.06.25, 07:18 schrieb "service@simsonn.com"

Hello, Probably buying tomorrow the brake upgrade kit so all the initial problems go away. Is it maybe possible to get a controller box or some parts of the kit on top. No need for replacement if I go with the upgrade. -- Gesendet mit der WEB.DE Mail App Am 23.06.25, 07:18 schrieb "service@simsonn.com"
你好，Dennis Hamzic，  当然，请告诉我们您需要哪些部件。您可以发截图给我们，我们会帮您确认。

Hello, So i think the new controller box for the plus x would be pretty great, maybe it will solve the problem with distortion of the signals. And I think to solve the problems with the rods I would go for the upgrade kit maybe the new rods don't start leaking an cover some things in grease. Would it be possible to get both things? Best regards Dennis Hamzic -- Gesendet mit der WEB.DE Mail App Am 25.06.25, 10:26 schrieb "service@simsonn.com"

Hi Dennis Hamzic,  If there’s any issue with our pedals, we’ll provide you with free replacement parts—no need to worry. Below are the links to the PlusX controller and the upgrade kit for your reference:      https://www.simsonn.com/products/simsonn-vam-pedals-haptic-reactor?variant=51351053533498     https://www.simsonn.com/products/plus-ultra-upgrade-kit?variant=51087403843898

Hello, What replacement parts will I get for the problems I mentioned in some mails earlier. Which information else do you need? Best regards Dennis Hamzic -- Gesendet mit der WEB.DE Mail App Am 26.06.25, 12:02 schrieb "service@simsonn.com"

Hi Dennis Hamzic,  I can see that your pedals are currently working properly, and there doesn’t seem to be any issue. If any damage occurs in the future, we’ll replace the parts for you free of charge. For now, everything looks fine, so there’s no need to worry.
